title: CEC-led EC delegation meets president at Bangabhaban
body: Ahead of announcing the schedule for the 13th national election and the referendum slated for next February, a team of the Election Commission (EC) led by Chief Election Commissioner (CEC) AMM Nasir Uddin went to Bangabhaban to meet President Mohammed Shahabuddin this noon. Around 11:00am, the five-member commission held an internal meeting at the EC headquarters in Dhaka's Agargaon. After that, around 11:40am, they left for Bangabhaban. As per tradition, before announcing the election schedule, the president is briefed on all preparations. After the briefing, the CEC announces the schedule through an address recorded for BTV and Bangladesh Betar. Meanwhile, security has been tightened around the EC building since yesterday afternoon. The CEC's address is scheduled to be recorded at the EC office this afternoon. The schedule will be announced with voting set for the first half of February. The national election and the referendum will be held on the same day, from 7:30am to 4:30pm. The EC also said yesterday that after the CEC's speech is recorded, the election schedule may be announced either this evening or tomorrow.
